name: Vaccination as Infection
description: A SIRD model with an additional infection that acts as vaccination
infectionTypes: There are two infections defined. One "normal" infection with β=0.4 and γ=0.04 and an additonal "vaccination" infection that has γ=0, so no way to "recover". Thus the vaccinated population remain "infected" and cannot be infected by the real infection.
groups: There are three groups. One for the Susceptible, one for Recovered and one for Deceased.
betaMultipliers: The beta multipliers are set up in the same way as for the normal SIRD model. Only the susceptible can infect and be infected.
transitions: After infection the susceptible are split 87.5% to Recovered and 12.5% to Deceased. This coresponds to γ = 0.04 · 0.875 = 0.35 and μ = 0.04 · 0.125 = 0.05 in traditional SIRD.
initialCondition: We start with 996.5 susceptible, 3 infected people and 0.5 vaccinated people.
globalBetaMultiplier: No global beta multiplier is used.
